sentences.english: Distress you then truth, dog is a hero.
sentences.chinese: 危难时见真情，狗也是英雄。

sentences.english: He helped the poor and rescued those in danger. He enjoyed doing good, and in particular, he never liked to kill anything.
sentences.chinese: 他济贫并救人于危难，喜欢行善，特别是从不杀生。

sentences.english: Each one for himself in times of peril.
sentences.chinese: 在危难的时刻人人都只顾自己。

sentences.english: Monday, he called this a tragic time for the state.
sentences.chinese: 周一，他称这次是本州的危难时刻。

sentences.english: True love means never giving up on each other in times of difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 真正的爱情是两个人在危难的时候相互傍依。

sentences.english: The best way out is to go through.
sentences.chinese: 出离危难最好多的办法就是穿行。

sentences.english: Grace for the trials, help from above, Unfailing sympathy, undying love.
sentences.chinese: 试炼得恩助，危难有赖，无限的体谅，不死的爱。

sentences.english: The people and governments of both Afghanistan and Pakistan are endangered.
sentences.chinese: 阿富汗和巴基斯坦的人民和政府都处在危难之中。

sentences.english: I entirely forgot the vows and promises that I made in my distress.
sentences.chinese: 我完全忘记了我在危难中发出的誓愿和诺言。

sentences.english: Among brothers, share foxholes, help each other in dire moments.
sentences.chinese: 兄弟间一同使用散兵坑，在危难时刻彼此帮助。

sentences.english: In times of crisis, those ties become lifelines.
sentences.chinese: 在危难之际，这些联系成为了生命线。

sentences.english: Her presence during the crisis had a calming effect.
sentences.chinese: 在危难中有了她就稳定了人心。

sentences.english: Du stands out in emergencies and makes all the right decisions。
sentences.chinese: 危难之时，杜拉拉站出来，作出了一个个正确的决定。

sentences.english: I'll be by you in the hour of danger.
sentences.chinese: 在危难时刻我会支持你。

sentences.english: Poor Sylvia got left in the lurch.
sentences.chinese: 可怜的西而维亚在危难中被人遗弃了。

sentences.english: The Sichuan earthquake gave witness to the kindness of strangers in an emergency.
sentences.chinese: 四川大地震见证了危难中的那些素不相识者的善举。

definition: to meet with misfortune/to fall into dire straits
assistance/a helping hand/to lend a hand
the critical moment/life and death crisis
misfortune/crisis/grave danger/critical situation/disaster/emergency/to be zealous in helping others out of a predicament
urgent and important moment (idiom); critical juncture
